inclusion.criterion: Active acromegaly due to excess GH produced by a pituitary adenoma.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Elevated IGF-I compared to age and gender matched controls (as supplied by the laboratory) and fail to suppress GH to below 1 ng/ml after a standard 75g oral glucose tolerance test.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, defined by elevated fasting glucose ≥ 126 mg/dl (verified by two historical measurements), or plasma glucose ≥ 200 mg/dl two hours after a 75 g oral glucose load, or a random glucose ≥ 200 mg/dl.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Current medical therapy for acromegaly including dopamine agonists, somatostatin analogues, or growth hormone antagonists.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with a history of surgical therapy for treatment of acromegaly must have verification of active disease with verified elevated IGF-I for the subjects' age and gender compared to healthy controls (as supplied by the laboratory) (two measures) as well as a failure to suppress GH to below 1 ng/ml after OGTT.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Current treatment for insulin resistance or type 2 DM including oral or injection medications.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has a history of acromegaly due to pituitary adenoma and underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. His lab study shows the IGF-1 level of 4.5 ULN adjusted by sex and age.
